summary: This is an email chain from December 2018 between FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the Epstein case. It discusses coordinating a meeting between their teams, the assignment of personnel to read the case file, and the transfer of FBI 302 interview reports.

persons.name: Russell
persons.context: Mentioned as having dropped off FBI 302 interview reports at the office and will follow up.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge, New York Field Office
persons.context: Sent an email stating that two people have been assigned to read the Epstein case file and that they will provide the 302s and schedule a meeting.

persons.name: Chief Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Chief, Public Corruption Unit, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Listed as the sender/recipient in the document header, indicating involvement in the coordination.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel involved in handling and transferring documents related to the Epstein investigation.
Communicating via email to coordinate a joint meeting and transfer of FBI 302 reports between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Email Coordination for Epstein Case Meeting
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office emails the FBI to request a joint meeting to discuss operational steps and to send FBI 302 reports.

events.title: FBI Assigns Personnel to Review Epstein File
events.description: The FBI's Assistant Special Agent in Charge emails to confirm that two people have been assigned to read the Epstein case file and that they will provide the 302s and schedule a meeting.

events.title: FBI 302 Reports Delivered
events.description: FBI Special Agent Russell drops off the FBI 302 interview reports at the office and will follow up.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The document shows active inter-agency coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office on the Epstein investigation in December 2018.
FBI 302 interview reports (formally documenting witness interviews) were being transferred from the FBI to federal prosecutors.
The FBI had assigned two personnel specifically to read the Epstein case file, indicating a focused review of the materials.
The email chain is partially redacted, concealing the specific email addresses and potentially the full names of some personnel involved.
